title: Gamification-Enhanced Civic Consciousness and Poverty Eradication Education

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary sociology theories and general awareness of global social issues
context.additional_context: Students engage in self-directed learning and online collaboration via an LMS platform using digital devices (laptops/tablets) and participate in simulation games based on real-world cases

learning_goals: Learners will be able to analyze three or more structural causes of global poverty and propose solutions.
Learners will be able to design and implement citizen-participatory problem-solving strategies through game-based activities.
Learners will be able to submit team project and simulation results in report format using digital collaboration tools.
Learners will be able to develop a plan to participate at least once in a citizen engagement project for solving community issues after completing the course.

resources: UN Food Force-Like Simulation Game License

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
